title: Desert National Park
review: there is so many activities are available here, like camel safari, jeep safari, folk dance. we had so much fun here. we had done jeep and camel ride here. tants are also available here if you want to stay here. then we have gone through the folk dance of rajasthan. and at the end of the program, even we had a dance. we have clicked so many pictures and videos here.

title: The Desert Endemics
review: Shrubs, unending vistas of sand, driving in and around the DNP was a mersmerising experience.... adding to this wonder was sighting the birds who were so well cameoflaged- the guest of honour- The Great Indian Bustard, creme courser, desert wheatear, red tailed wheatear, issabeline and variable wheatear, striolated bunting, trumpeter finch, asian desert warbler, greater short toed lark, greater hoopoelark,, blackcrowned sparrowlark, bimaculated lark, desert lark.....it was delightful watching the imperial eagle, tawny eagle, laggar falcon along with 6 different types if vultures out in the open, standing out in the vastness.

title: Best place to experience the Desert in Jaisalmer
review: The Desert National Park is a must visit for any nature enthusiast. The sanctuary has many species of birds which include Vultures, Shrikes, Partridges, Eagles, Kestrels, Coursers etc. (only to name a few)

title: Desert sand dunes are very few crowded not advises for family with kids and jeep riding is scary
review: Desert sand dunes are very few crowded and jeep riding is scary. The jeep ride can be scary as they drive very fast and bumpy not at all fun and safe. Desert is huge by dunes are few and awfully crowded. Can be avoided and total no of with family and kids

title: Interesting ecosystem
review: Very original name, but the park seems well kept, not many sand dunes, probably due to the sheer number of people here, several camel/truck hire places beating the sand and ancient salt crusts away. The roads are quite well looked after and are quite eerie at sundown!

title: Mesmerising, Mind blowing
review: This was by far our best experience in Rajasthan. The desert national park is a world apart and doesn't feel like you're in India. You would feel like you are in the deserts of another country. Minimal habitat, little houses in the middle of nowhere, small kids looking at you with so much of love and admiration is something you will never forget. The landscape is superb, especially near some famous spots where the cactus plants grow tall. If you are in Jaisalmer, this place is a must visit. If you are a wildlife enthusiast like me, you might want to also try and catch a glimpse of the Great Indian Bustard, a species that we might only see in books in the near future. You should just go there for the experience and I'm sure you'll be in awe of the clean and pristine sand dunes inside the national park.

title: Experience the Wild West
review: A must visit for those who want to see the desert. Most of the terrain is flat arid desert,sand dunes are few. We spotted a sleepy desert fox with a bushy white tail, couple of eagles and deer. The roads are really good and it covers two or three different areas. If one is lucky one could spot the great India Bustard, but we did not see any of though. A special mention about Aliyar  Rojani who took us on the safari and his knowledge of the fauna here.

title: Family visit
review: The camel ride is real wonderful experience. The tents and the music and dance program are refreshing and enjoyable

title: A paradise for wildlife enthusiasts
review: If you are a keen wildlife lover and want to explore some beyond the usual attractions of Jaisalmer then DNP is a good option. We specially here to spot GIB and we were very very lucky to spot 7 GIB at the same time. We also saw vultures, chinkaras, and a desert cat. Only go here if you love wildlife. It is a treat for experiencing desert wildlife.

title: Interesting National Park
review: You realize it is there when you are moving towards the dunes; the signboard announces that. However to naked eye and someone just looking you do not find much except rocks and a few birds with a bit of vegetation thrown in. I wish I could explore it properly.

title: Desert and desert
review: I thought that i will face a lot of sand and desert , but wheni reached there i fount desert sand was in few km area, i was disappointed

title: comfortable camel safari
review: we took a camel safari into the desert here.  Very nice experience, great views, great sleep, lots of wind turbines

title: Searching for Birds of the Dry Country
review: I have rated Desert National Park as an excellent attraction, since we saw what we had come to see there.  We were on a birding excursion with Kalypso Birding (based in Kerala) and wanted to see the birds of the dry country, and there are many, and we saw lots of them.  In addition to our Kalypso guide, who knew the birds well, we always had to have a local guide from the park hop in our van.  They could not speak English, but they did know where to go to find the more sought after birds like the Great Indian Bustard.  We were based at the Prince Desert Safari Camp, and spent two full days birding in various sections of the park.  As the birds of the dry country are not the colourful birds of India's woodlands, it was helpful to have Satyan, our birding guide, with us, as he knew the birds' calls and their whereabouts and has a good eye for spotting them.

title: Huge Expanse of sand. Can see miles together on camel
review: Visited during peak summer. The desert is huge and if you on a camel, you could see desert for miles together with no end to the sand. Watched a deer.

title: natural beauty
review: very good atmosphere and feel very close to nature. love to visit . natural beauty.i want to say that it is really a fantastic to visit in this park.

title: Must visit
review: This place is worth the visit. Try to visit the area in morning and ask your tour guide to arrange camel cart if you want to see Great Indian bustard from near.

title: Never go alone, your trip can become scary
review: It is beautiful to watch vast stretch of sand. This dunes are not polluted as they are in sam dunes. Travel in groups to avoid any issues. Meet forest guard before 8 Am and book a camel cart to visit it from inside.

title: Not a lot of people visit this extraordinary place
review: The temples and the fort are unique in all of India. The desert is beautiful. Travel by land is hard.  Take the plane.

title: Nice experience.
review: It is worth visiting the place in the evening. Ride a camel and  feel  the soft desert wind on your face. Enjoy the sunset with your beloved. Do not pay more than 300 rupees per person.

title: An opportunity to  visit the desert of Jaisalmer
review: wow! the ride into the desert is a bit rough but seeing the sunrise was really beautiful .

title: Nice National Park
review: The Desert National Park is located close to the Sam Sand Dunes and one can combine the two trips. We had a helpful guide who could point out to us various birds during our camel cart safari in the park.

title: Everyone should do this - great fun!
review: This was a lot of fun! We met our camels and guides an hour before sunset and rode out into the dunes. Slow and peaceful ride out and a prime spot on top of a dune to watch the "show".  Many excited Indian kids and lots of camel-riding adults all having a great time - we did too!!

title: Enjoyed the wide expanse, the sunsets and sunrises
review: We spent 2 days in desert camping.  Both mornings and evenings were fantastic with the varying views of desert and sky, changing by the minute.  Great experience

title: Desert Safari
review: Reach this place about two hours before sunset. Settle for a Camel Safari. The guide will take you through the dunes to the best possible point for relaxing and enjoying a quiet sunset.

title: Mini Sahara and effective wildlife conservation park
review: I really enjoyed our overnight stay on the dunes of Desert National Park.  We took a camel safari with Wanderlust Camel Safari and slept under the stars on the sand.

title: Sand dunes safari
review: Its a vast desert park but you are typically taken to a few sand dunes where you can camp or just make a day visit. Camel safari, Quad-bike safari (available only in one place) or Jeep safari's are available in sand dunes. If the sky is clear, you can watch Sunset on dunes. There are live music shows in the night and dinner included if you take a day package from one of the travel agents. Its a unique experience which you don't experience usually.

title: Ecosystem of the Thar
review: The Desert National Park is an excellent example of the ecosystem of the Thar Desert. Sand dunes form around 20% of the Park. The landform primarily comprises rocks and compact salt lake bottoms.

title: Spectacular sunset behind the dunes
review: The whole experience of the desert was great. The camp, the camel riding, the dunes themselves. We had time to walk around and enjoy the sunset. The only disappointment was that some people were leaving behind their empty plastic water bottles which were scattered on the dunes.

title: Unique and fragile ecosystem
review: located in western India in the fascinating sand dunes of Rajasthan. One of the largest national parks in India, extending over an area of 3,100 sq. km., the Desert National Park is a unique and fragile ecosystem. More than 60 per cent of it is simply semi-arid desert. The seemingly barren lands but full or flora n fauna.

title: A cemel rise at sunset
review: Persuaded to go on this trip to the sand dunes by camel and it was not really worth the effort, as I found the sunset over the dunes is ruined by power lines across the desert and permanent tented camps.  Do not waste your time going on this sunset camel ride and spend the time instead relaxing in the hotel gardens after a busy hot day in Jaisalmer.

title: Activity
review: Enjoy the Sams dunes situated there with a camel or jeep safari. It is a memorable experience one cannot miss.

title: Deserted park
review: Not much to see here , it is fenced all over but if ur lucky u may see fox or other animals . U can enter from any side but if park officer see u he'll charge around three hundred bucks else its free if ur not spotted.If ur scared of loneliness then don't go here but if u like calm place then this is good choice to roam around but get ur water and eatables along as this is desert we are talking about.

title: Camel safari and Parasailing.. :)
review: Camel ride is available everywhere here. If you are a fan of it, do go for it. They take you for 10-15 minutes round for couple of hundred rupees.

title: Excellent adventure being there
review: Excellent adventure being there. YOu wont believe for a while if you are in Thar desert or Sahara. It's little brother of Sahara ofcourse. Dont expect much but yes it is great adventure passing through or camping here.

title: Awesome place
review: Beautiful, calm and serene, thats how I would describe it. I went there twice last year for photography with my friend. You will find many type of birds and mammals which give you a good photo opportunity. you can enjoy camel safari in side the park or jeep safari around, however you need to pre arrange it. Dont forget to carry water bottles and food as there is nothing in and around the national part.

title: Between Sam Sand dunes and Khuri: large stretch of barren wilderness!
review: This is behind Sam sand dunes, many people seem to be confused with sand dunes itself.

title: Good desert, but tourists and locals are not responsible
review: Visited Sam desert and area and tried dunes bashing. I also took a came ride. Camel rider was in great hurry as he had to ferry other passengers. Spent some time in the dunes. However local vendors were selling beers at an extra cost and tourists and camel riders /vendors were throwing empty bottles and cans in the dunes. So both are extremely irresponsible. I felt sad looking at cans and other trash. Indian tourists and locals must understand that they are spoiling their own place. Government should ban selling beers or anything in plastic or cans. On the road going from Jaisalmer to Sam, lot of trash could be seen on the roadside

title: It's Ok, but nothing too special
review: Being in the Thar desert, we decided to visit it properly (camels and all the stuff). Fortunately, we decided not spend a night at one of the tented camps that were offered to us.

title: Desert safari is attraction in Jaisalmer
review: Very nearer to Jaisalmer city so one can opt stay one night at SAM desert national park. Its not upto the mark the sand dun were so small you can't feel desert safari. Even no zeep driver removing air from tyre so it becomes more bouncy rather than thrill.

title: Gotta Do Thar
review: If you are in Jaisalmer you simply cannot miss Desert National Park aka Thar Desert.

title: Barren has a beauty of its own
review: Your Jaisalmer trip can't be complete without visiting the Sam sand dunes - in fact I'd say you could plan your Jaisalmer trip solely for the dunes. Its worth it. For one, you wouldn't get to see such landscape anywhere in India and second - you wouldn't get an opportunity to do a Jeep safari in midst of the dunes.

title: An experience
review: Some of the group rode camel and others went by camel cart into the dunes to watch sunset. Then went to a desert camp, for singing, dancing show before sitting down to a buffet dinner. Very entertaining evening

title: Amazing
review: I went to Desert National Park. It is called home by a number of exotic animal and bird species in a vast variety including chinkara, black buck, sand grouse, desert gerbil and blue bull. It is great place to go.

title: Most of Camel Desired Park
review: Enjoyed to see Desert National Park. Second to the camel, the Indian Bustard is the most important animal of the Thar desert. This endangered Bird calls the Desert National Park at Jaisalmer is home. Although preservation efforts are on, but ours might be the last generation to see this majestic animal. We also found a plethora of migratory birds that visited the park. It is a riot of colours just before the winter sets in and is perfect for bird watchers.

title: A Waste of Time and Money
review: So touristy, it was actually very ridiculous. A few days after DiWali, packed with local tourist, dirty and very busy, with vendors everywhere.  People and camels everywhere.  If you have ever been to the Sahara and ridden a camel, this was a complete waste of time and money.

title: Super Aventure
review: Desert National Park in Jaisalmer is very popular, there are having number of tent camps around that. if you would like to stay in the middle of desert in tent. good adventure activities are there, specially zeep safari and camel riding.

title: Beautiful and Different but Deserted and Secluded Place
review: Its an actual desert and nothing is available on this approximately 25 km stretch starting from Sam towards Khuri. Not even a shelter, water, or anything else. Only a watchtower in the middle of the national park. You can see here the Great Indian Bustard if you are lucky. Else you can see deers, vultures etc easily. There is one straight narrow road which is at some places filled with sand. So its a little difficult to ride on this road. Its a very different experience to be here.

title: Very serene and beautiful place.
review: Camel ride was very good.Serene and beautiful place.Very popular place for camel rides.Good tourist attraction!!.

title: Fun !! Fun !! Fun !!
review: A fun break from city tours - a desert safari driving across the sand dunes in the desert watching the sunset.

title: Fun ride to it.
review: we spotted great indian bustard hence everything was awesome. Visit it to explore the horizon and vastness of the city. Treat yourself to merging vast land and the sky.

title: Superb
review: A must must visit place , Camel ride ,jeep safari added extra joy to the trip. The desert looks amazing when the sun goes down.

title: Jeep safari
review: We went as a party of 22, jeeps all there, drinks ordered! The jeep safari was amazing, so much fun, even though we all came back covered in bruises!. We sat to watch the sun going down, with local rum, Indian dancers and musicians. Camel rides were available if desired. I would definitely recommend this trip, drinks are expensive but the locals are only trying to make a living!

title: everyone  should experience once in life time
review: every one should experience desert life once , its super full warm and jeep safari super , camel ride ultimate

title: No words to express the joy and experience, MUST, MEMORABLE for Lifetime
review: We went to sand dunes had jeep safari and camel ride both are great

title: spoiled experience by over tourism
review: I went as an independent traveller on a motorbike from Jaisalmer to sam sand dunes. Had a camel ride which was fun and cheap but uncomfortable. You would do an hour max if you ride horses but 30 mins was enough for me. I went early afternoon and had the dunes all to myself, not a soul about. Easy to organise a ride. Barter as they are desperate for your money.

title: desert safari
review: very nice desert safari. beautiful sand dunes. stay in tent is wonderful with good food and kalbeliya dance

title: Just another tourist attraction
review: The large expanse of desert looks great but there is not much wildlife there, other than few jackals nears some bushes.  Jeep safari was a little dangerous as the driver was driving too fast and one of the co-passenger was hurt on her head.

title: Great Stay at Sam
review: We stayed at Prince Desert Camp at Sam Dunes. The entire arrangement, pick up from the station and drop back to Jaisalmer was perfect. The camp is secluded and away from the noisier part of Sam. The arrangements and the entertainment were very good.

title: A must visit experience
review: Jeep safari in the desert is a must. It was amazing. Camel safari and camel cart safari was also good but Jeep safari was best

title: Must Visit National park
review: Desert National Park (DNP) is the most unique and largest national park of India, ranging over 3162 sq.Km spread over Jaisalmer and Barmer districts of Rajasthan. DNP is around 2hrs drive from Jaisalmer city.You can travel via Sam or Khuri to Sudhagiri village which has a forest check post.You can purchase tickets and hire camel cart to enter DNP. Better to book Camel cart one day in advance.Major attraction of the park is the Great Indian Bustard however one can see variety of migratory birds, specially the raptors.

title: Thar
review: After seeing The great indian thar versatility of india realize..thar has there unique beauty of nature ...crestal like sand and lots of camel and panoramic view of thar all awesome

title: Camel ride
review: It was pretty awesome..weather was very foggy on 31st Dec morning and going on the dune in camel back was fun. They made camel go fast sometimes and i almost felt as if i will fall. Its an adventure when camel sits or stands.

title: Loads of Deer.
review: Managed to see loads of deer there. Wasn't lucky enough to spot other wildlife. Must be visited early morning or in the evenings.

title: Evenings !
review: we went here in summer so people advised us against going to the desert as it would be very hot. but, we were pleasantly surprised that neither the sand was hot not the weather. there was cool breeze blowing and hiked a little and sat atop a sand hill in the middle of the desert. we watched the sun go down and asked for the camel cart to come pick us once it started getting dark. its all fun till night sets in and there are quite ugly black beetles all around. so make sure you leave before it starts getting dark.

title: Lovely Dessart
review: Desert is the main attraction of Jaisalmer city. It is around 45 km from city and area known as Sam dunes.

title: Sure bucket list must do
review: 1 night in a tent in the desert under a starry sky is surely a must do.its something you will remember. We stayed at the winds resort my husband me and 2 found kids and it was perfect.everything is taken care. . the silence of the desert is amazing. Don't book tents near the sand dunes as there is lots of noise and lights due to maximum resorts being there. Want to enjoy the desert stay away, choose winds

title: Serene
review: Very amazing experience to be so far out of the hustle and bustle of India's cities and just watching the sand blow across the dunes. I was surprised at how many scrub trees and goats there were, also roaming camels. I missed the sunset because I was showing some desert boys pictures of snow on my iPhone but the sunrise was completely amazing.

title: Beautiful desert safari
review: This is one of the largest parks in India. A jeep safari into the park will let you see some flora, fauna, and a large number of migratory birds.

title: Wilderness Redefined
review: Binocular Hunting for the Great Indian Bustard Bird is the highlight of a drive through this park; nicknamed as 'DNP'. Travel from Sam Road or, Khuri Road to Sudhagiri and meet up with the Forest Officials for better spotting. You may also spot the usual wanderers of the deserts; including the Evergreen Camel.

title: Camell and Jeep Safari was Excellant
review: Camel and Jeep Safari is great fun but booking should be done on the spot and not through the agent .

title: Amazing Dunes
review: “We had a lovely experience in the dunes-- camping in two-person tents with campfire, music, and good food. Camel riding at sunset. A good memory! and well organized.

title: A touris colony with a few sand dunes.
review: Bad food, bad dance and average music. Too many tourists per sand dune. You don't have the feeling being in the desert. Camel boys ask you during the whole trip for tips and aftwer 5 minutes tell you to go down from the camel unless you give them money. Nothing much to see on the trip ext6ension. More tourists than sand dunes

title: Amazing and unforgettable experience
review: This is the first time,I had visited sand desert of Thar ,in my life.

title: A national part unlike others
review: This national park is unlike the others with dense forest, obviously, its a desert park. Could see some deers in the park in open areas running here and there. Bird lovers can find some rare birds too. But its not a must place.

title: A Unique National Park of India
review: The Great Indian Desert, or the Thar desert is the 1.3 Million Square KM desert area between India and Pakistan. It's one of the most spectacular landscape comprising desert planes, dunes, scrubs and some of the most amazing desert wildlife.

title: Moments
review: The most interesting place of a trip we like  the most and want to visit here again and again great to be at desert

title: Unforgettable Rides at SAM
review: From the tent we went deep into the desert by camel and returned to the tent by jeep via the sunset point.

title: Must visit in jaisalmer
review: A palace where camel safari also available. A palace for watch sunset. A best palace for all animal lover.

title: Beautiful experience.
review: The sunset was amazing. The camelride to be skipped. We booked a camelcart ride but they let us got onto camels Clinging for your lives to stay on top Not worth it Afterwards we realised that we have been cheated.

title: Fascinating people and wildlife
review: You can take a touristy (uncomfortable, overpriced) camel safari into the desert, spending a night in the dunes, or a more worthwhile expedition by jeep to find the critically-endangered Great Indian Bustard in the Desert National Park. Along the way, you might visit villages in the middle of nowhere, a waterhole with terrific birdlife, or spot antelope and vultures. Whatever you do, don't visit Jaisalmer without visiting the desert too!

title: Stone desert, few sand areas
review: There are small strips of sandy desert, the rest it is mostly rocky. Do not expect Sahara, but it is anyway very fascinating and you can see many people living there almost as during the old times.

title: Amazing Experience of Desert !!!
review: We visited with family this month and our experience of desert in Sam Sand Dunes (Desert National Park) was really very amazing and exceptional. Camel and Jeep safari are best adventure.

title: Desert Amazing
review: Desert national Park the amazing place. The experience of Sam Sand Dunes desert was awesome. The camel cart and camel ride, then jeep ride was just superb.

title: Average
review: Well i gotta say i was quite disappointed with the tour, the guides, the day in general because they profit everything they can to make money.

title: Humy dumy back of camel 😂👉🐴 awesome
review: Very good place for travelling and what a camel ride wondefull amazing ! Amazing!  !!!!!!    Humy Dumy back side of camel youneed go there you enjoy so much and side by side you also eat  food nothing's say just i say a fabulous place and wonderfully ride.  Thxs

title: Thar Desert.
review: Desert National park is very good  palace but in this park we not seen any animal. but  it was very quite and peacefully as name.

title: Fantastic experince in winter 2017, saw a lot of desert animales.
review: We saw a lot of desert animales like antelopes on a camel trip over 8 hours. Nice guide and of course the camels were a Little bit uncomfortable. :-)

title: Ok place
review: This place is OK. If you have seen beter deserts in the us ot the middle east, this wont impress you. The hundreds of stray cattle is heart wrenching for me personally

title: Beautiful, go and enjoy every moment
review: I visited Jaisalmer 3 times and everytime I come here, it's for Sam dunes only. Beautiful, nothing fancy, far from pomp and show of metros. Just go to desert, sit, relax and enjoy every moment. And, not to forget the sunrise and sunset in desert :). And for pricing, please make sure you have some idea about the camps(check rates on sites). For snacks, water bottle etc, better to carry from Jaisalmer, rather buy some unknown branded stuffs from locals.

title: Birding Watching
review: Great place to bird watch. I saw four Great Bustards which is an endangered species in India. Also saw Cream-Colored Courser, Red-Headed Vultures, Black-Crowned Lark-Sparrow and Great Spotted Eagle and others.

title: A grand safari
review: A truely royal place with huge sand dunes and camel cart rushing with gusto. A place to watch the sun set in the horizon with least obstructions. The place is worth a couple of visits.

title: must see location
review: situated at mid of desert and good place to see . you can see the real desert at this place .enjoyed

title: Great views photographer delight
review: The desert Park has lot of amazing things to put up from Huge Cactus to Sand Dunes to Camel.deer fox and great birds in winters..The landscape also changes every 10 kms

title: Enjoy the safari
review: Enjoy the following

title: EXCELLENT PLACE TO EXPERIENCE
review: A must visit for a Jaisalmer visitor, to experience the true beauty of the desert, try the camel rides. They are an awesome experience to ride the camels over the sand dunes. Try a time towards the evening the setting sun gives a wonderful golden hues to the desert.

title: Golden Sand
review: Our first ever experience of Sam Dunes was truly exceptional. Camel and Jeep safari makes it well worth to visit.

title: The experience leaves you with golden memories, refreshes the soul
review: Once at least in a lifetime, one must experience the Sam Sand Dunes, especially the Jeep Safari, Para Sailing, Camel ride and the Sunset view.

title: Marvellous Desert National Park
review: The main land of the park comprises compact salt lake bottoms,fixed dunes and craggy rocks.The park is inhabited by tawny eagles,vultures,kestrel,lager falcons etc.There are many lakes inside the national park including rajbaugh lake,Milak Lake and Padam Talao lake.

title: Bustard one shot from very far and finished
review: Difficult to talk about this place.

title: Sam dunes are mesmerizing
review: Sam dunes are a must visit (they are better than Khuri village imo). Dont pre book anything you can get the best rates. I got 100 for a 15 minute camel ride and 800 for a 20 minute jeep ride on dunes ( for 7 people). Touts in Jaisalmer will try to offer a package of 500 rs and include a dinner and folk dance at a nearby camp site (food is bad at best and dance is passable). Suggest if you want to see an actual folk dance, drive down to one of the villages and dine with them. They will be mor than happy to let you enter their houses, share their customs with you and cook you a simple traditional marwadi meal. You can leave whatever you think was worth to them instead of falling in the touristy trap of camp sites (PS:its cold, uncomfortable and full of drunk people who come to see the dances and shower money)

title: evening camel experience.
review: We went here at sunset for a camal ride. The leaders were very friendly making the ride very enjoyable. The whole experience very enjoyable. It took about 30 minutes to get there from Jaisalmer.

title: Experiencing Thar desert
review: Camel safari in the desert national park was an awesome experience. Initially we were totally confused to choose between Khuri and Sam as we wanted to experience the best possible within a day. We drove to Khuri village from Jaisalmer around 2PM and explored the village. As the safari packages were high priced we engaged a camel man (Pumaram) from the village to visit the dunes. The young chap was very hospitable and friendly. He charged just Rs 250 per person. He patiently taught our children to ride the camel (they even learnt to gallop) On the dunes we enjoyed sunset and danced to the tunes of traditional rajasthani music played by a folk artist. Unfortunately we didn't have enough time to go on a long safari, so taking the advice of the camel man we returned to the national park early in the morning and spotted wildlife... desert eagle, black buck and smaller mammals and enjoyed sunrise.

title: The Desert : the must-experience
review: People may go to Rajasthan mainly for 2 reasons: 1. The forts / palaces and 2. The Desert. Most foe the people go for both. The desert is a beautiful experience. You can have a lot of memories to bring back. Avoid summer because it would be too hot. We went in Dec - which was cold, but the desert experience was superb!

title: Clean environment, beautiful sky in night and friendly localites
review: Ours was a official trip to DNP and SAM dunes. We were lucky to see a pair of Great Indian Bustard. Visitors can enjoy walk in DNP and camel ride on sand dunes.  Jeep Safari in night was a thrilling experience.

title: Desert National Park
review: Desert National Park is very beautiful attraction of golden sand. famous picnic spot between foreign and indian tourist must see and enjoy nature's beauty.

title: Worth it
review: We went to see the Great Indian Bustard and we managed to sight one. It's a big bird and took flight right in front of us. Lizards, Nilgai, Birds could be spotted easily. Kids enjoyed the camel cart ride through the park.

title: Golden views and great wildlife
review: DNP is a place like nowhere else. The scenery is mesmerizing with golden hues all around. The park has been fenced by the forest department and separated from the numerous fields that surround it.The best way to experience it would be to go around the fence with a local guide. The park offers easy sighting of the numerous raptors that are found here.But the main attraction is the Great Indian Bustard. I was lucky to see two of them as sighting is rare. I found a local guide by the name of Urus Khan who is a local and lives near the park. He knows the way around and is really passionate about the wildlife. He can be reached on 9461545223 or 952165260. A must visit site for nature lovers

title: Sandy ,Windy and Cool
review: The desert safari is fun, riding on camel, you will enjoy it, but yes during season/peak time it is over crowded and lots of vehicles.

title: If your bird watcher!
review: The endangered bird , great indian bustard is found here ! I went to this place searching for it ! The place is far off from Jaisalmer and totally deserted , so carry your supplies ! I had to request the guard there to cook something for us as there was nothing on the way. But the place is amazing in winters , there were plenty of birds , raptors around. Couldn't spot GIB but hopefully some other day !

title: Another facet of natural beauty
review: Visit for open desert spaces and shrubs..... Animals are difficult to spot but Deer and reptile varities can be spootted..... Go with open mind..... to enjoy space

title: Fill the thirl........
review: something really lovely experience. Experience the thrill with Jeep Safari when it sops in the middle of the dessert that's also half tilled.   Scary.  thrilling. Unbelievable.  Unforgettable exprince of Jeep Safari

title: Camel ride in the desert nation park be aware
review: It was a good experience in  the late  afternoon  our camel owners were friendly we had a good ride in the desert they stop the camels we had a walk  and had pics taken with them and the camels then back the whole trip was about 45 mins.we were told by our guide to be careful about some of the camel owners makeyoubuy drinks them as well and charge you four  to five times the price  and they ask for big tip at the end of the trip.we gave them 200 indr each.its a place you go once its for family /visitors but it was a good experience happy to have done it in jaisalmer do recommend visitors to be careful when they are there its very busy place  guide advice should  be taken seriously. Good camel ride and don't  be too  friendly with the camels owners.

title: Sand Sea
review: A beautiful place to see 1. Desert Fox 2. Great Indian Bustard

title: Interesting but ........
review: My camel cart ride started just after dawn and it was quite cool as we started off.  Perhaps I was there at the wrong time and although we did see some birds they were at a distance so it was difficult to photograph them.  I did get to see the only lizard that inhabits the park and I caught a glimpse of a desert fox as it took off when it saw the cart.

title: nice
review: Very beautiful experience of desert and deep inside the desert.. Camel safari started in the evening was marvelous..

title: Nothing special
review: It was our first time seeing sand dunes, but unfortunately the dunes are not as big as you would expect, further adding to the disappointment, there is so much of filth and plastic bottles and waste lying around which kills the entire vibe of the place. additionally I will never recommend staying over in the tented accomodations.

title: If you need to experience Desert in non Desert area...BE THEIR
review: Excellent desert experience on a camel ride. When you visit then keep at least 2-3 hrs in hand to make a trip. Go deep inside the desert and enjoy the vastness of sand.

title: Must Visit
review: I was really surprised to see how green a desert national park was. Entry to the park was Rs 50 per person (for Indian tourists) and Rs 200 for the car parking. You can hire a camel cart for Rs 800 and take a 2 hour drive through the park. As the weather was good, we chose to walk instead. The park is home to the Great Indian Bustard but it is difficult to spot. We narrowly missed it and we know this because there were footprints next to ours on the path when we retraced our steps on our way back :) There were plenty of other birds though. Camping is also allowed in the park for a certain fee.

title: "Amazing Experiences!!! Fun filled, Very close to nature"
review: I'll rate this desert experience is the best in the entire Jaisalmer Trip. lovely Sam Sand Dunes...tumble in sand, Camel ride, jeep safari, cultural programmes, mouth watering food...be close to nature Tent stay,  witness sunset and count twinkling stars...what not??? It must be around 40 kms from main town...you need a vehicle to reach there. On the way you can cover Kuldhara deserted village and try paragliding on the way back. My personal experience, book online a good desert stay near sam dunes with evening dance shows ( most of the camps are accessible by road)...reach there, on spot only you can directly negotiate and fix camel rides...up to sunset point or want to cover more distance, try it...get dropped to the start place...few hundreds is enough. I vote for direct booking either paragliding or jeep safari...for night, light winter clothing required during winters...enjoy the real fun.

title: Thrilling and Beautiful
review: Go for jeep and camel safari here. Its a nice experience. Try to see the sunset from sand dunes.It is safe for travelling.

title: One of My Best birding Birding Experience
review: Even though Mid March is not considered the best time to visit the Desert National Park DNP, the 1 full fat I spent riding around the park in a camel cart is one of the most memorable outings I have ever had. The beautiful landscape and the richness of avian life of this desert savanna deserves a must visit by every nature enthusiast.

title: something different
review: It was pretty cool being out in the desert for the first time, the weather was lovely and it wasn't windy.

title: Sand Dunes
review: We visit Jaisalmer first time and without any plan.

title: nice place in winters.
review: The endangered Indian bustard is the major attraction of Desert National Park. Brown and white in colour, the bustard is a metre tall and has long bare legs and a long neck. One can spot this tall and graceful ground-dwelling bird near the Sudashri waterhole. Sam Sand Dunes:

title: Beautiful place
review: Seating dessert and touch the sand is something really lovely experience. Experience the thrill with Jeep Safari when it sops in the middle of the dessert that's also half tilled.

title: Largest National Park
review: Desert Nation Park is the largest national park and a very good example of eco system.The park is god collections of Fossil which are very old and some of are 180 million years old.

title: Jaisalmer desert national park
review: I don't understand why it is called a national park in the first place. as the only animal visible is camel ,camel and camel...well some not so interesting birds can be spotted ...worth giving a miss.

title: must visit
review: a good experience with family, enjoyed camel safari &  cultural program at camps in night...should not recommend to families in summers

title: The Sahara of Jaisalmer
review: BEFORE you go out into the desert, make sure you have a reputable tour operator to take you.  There are many operators who will take you to nearby sand dunes and many other tourists.  Some of the shady operators will leave rubbish behind in the dunes which sadly detracts from the natural beauty.

title: Great Destination
review: This is good destination which like to Peace in life. if you want to visit adventure & peaceful destination this is great for u

title: very very beautiful palace
review: the royal  desert situated in barmer and jaisalmer distt. the world famous sum desert dunes are here . our state bird GODAWAN is living in desert nation park .

title: Must do
review: It's a must do experience, when you are in Jaisalmer. That night was special and it wasn't cold at all. Camels and camel boys were great!

title: Either SAM Dunes OR Khuri Dunes
review: If u really want enjoy the Sunset in a less crowded and a clean place then visit the Khuri Dunes. Even stay here. I stayed at The Mamas Resort.

title: Nature's at its best
review: For nature lovers it is worth visiting. The park is located close by and well connected by road. One should hire a guide to go around.

title: LESS DIRT PLEASE - Menos sujeira por favor
review: The desert is beautiful. We saw some animals as deers and foxs. In the night the moon illuminated the sand but the neglect and filth that spreads is revolting. Broken bottles, abundant plastics, including in the bushes. A pitty.  Local authorities should educate, guide and supervise people. In a short time the dunes will be transformed into a garbage dump. I let my tears.

title: Great place to relax
review: It was a great day at a great place. The park is awesome

title: The perfect spot for a camel ride
review: Our hotel, the Shahi Palace, arranged our tour to the desert, by camel.    It was great fun and our group were the only people saw.  The food prepared by our guides was excellent.

title: Really Good !!!
review: The real feel of the desert can be had if you spend a night among the stars in the desert. The night sand sparkles in moon light and that gives a great feeling. You will also be able to see the desert vegetation alongwith desert animals and birds.

title: Sam dunes
review: nice sand dunes, with desert camps in the middle, good for a night's stay, to see the sunset and sunrise. Must-do in Jaisalmer.

title: Visited Sundasri in the DNP
review: Visited Desert National park at Sundasri, coudn't see any bird or animal. Nothing interesting, can be skipped.

title: What an Experience!!!!!
review: Visited Thar Desert. What a place!! One must take a Jeep Safari in Desert.It's a life time memorable experience. Camel Safari is also good. Sunset from the desert is unbelievable. Strongly recommended for visit Thar Desert.

title: Sand hi sand
review: The view from here is fantastic and sunset is a special attraction. But one should avoid staying in the tents for obvious reasons unless too adventurous.

title: Must visit place in jaisalmer
review: Its near about jaisalmer called village"sum". Here camel ride is required to visit in dessert of sands. One night stay in tent is really an awesome experience.

title: Stark Beauty
review: We were lucky to see a desert fox and a couple of Cinkaras during our visit. This was a totally new terrain for us, and there is a kind of stark beauty in the vastness and desolateness of the Thar. Beautiful!

title: Very good experience of the desert
review: The desert experience is a part of a half day tour which includes camel ride to the Sam dunes, then a visit to a tented resort etc. We experienced the sun set which was spectacular just that that evening it became cloudy. Definitely a must do.

title: real desert
review: its wonder full natural view and good place to visit. i have been dubai it far more better and cool place than that and its is very cheap

title: A Great Place to Visit to Experience the Desert
review: The most commonly visited point here are the Sam Sand Dunes located about 40 kms from Jaisalmer. There are lot of tour operators who have their camps here with the option of staying in their tents. We went just for the evening wherein we took a camel ride on the dunes. Watching the sun set from the dunes is an awesome experience. One can also have dinner at one of the caps which is preceeded by a cultural show by the local artistes which is quiet good. Overall a very nice experience.

title: A destination which keeps me calling everyday
review: Speechless - Jaisalmer has been my all time favourite. Love to visit whenever I have time and money..1st thing comes in my mind is JAISALMER JAISALMER JAISALMER

title: The Other Side of Nature...
review: If you love forests and greenery, this is where you should be too...total dryness and sand dunes everywhere...It is totally confirmed mind blowing experience for an urban traveler who wants to see the beauty with which the sand dunes are created and an artistic sunset which just happens over the dunes to make it more cinematic to your eyes then any movie you have ever watched.

title: natural beauty with tough life....
review: Its good place to visit. camel safari or jeep safari is nice. watching sunset in sand dunes is awesome.  guys make sure that u have advance bookings if u r planning to stay in tents or huts with family and kids. cultural program is also good. but noting new if u r visiting second time. if u choose good resort then food will be good. but if ur selection is average u have to compromise in all matter. dont entertain tauts / lapka (guys on bikes offer u safari with luxury stay in star hotels in very low price). otherwise u will mess ur tour. fix the price before hiring any camel or jeep as they will ask gratuity . Don't drink and drive  as specialized trauma facilities are not available nearby. Dance and enjoy village life. you will really love it...

title: Busy! Average sand dunes
review: We drove out to watch the sunset and could not believe how many people there were. You are constantly harangued for camel rides. Compared to Morocco the sand dunes are very average. There are tented accommodations for miles. Ok for a quick look

title: Beautiful and tranquil escape
review: Beautiful and tranquil escape, great place to watch the sunset. We did a camel ride followed by dinner by a fire in the desert dunes. Very relaxing and scenic. Memorable experience.

title: Beautiful
review: My experience was really amazing in Desert park. I really enjoyed a lot. I did camel safari and it took us to see the sunset which was amazing.

title: Beware of the rates asked by the camel safari and jeep safari people!
review: the people who take you to camel safari ask for too high rates and they have no constant price! you should just be cautious while dealing with them

title: An unforgettable experience
review: This is a lifetime experience. We went to SAM sand dunes by Camel cart, witnessed an unforgettable sunset and had dinner in one of resorts with ethnic cultural programs. The only thing that I would like to caution the fellow travellers to be very cautious about the camel tour operators, all of whom are very unscrupulous.

title: Go, but barter hard for your camel ride
review: We drove 45km west toward the Pakistani border to Khuri Dunes.  Sam Dunes has more tourists apparently.  Our guide had to barter with the camel drivers so that my husband and I each had our own camel.  Sitting tandem is very uncomfortable.  Also, make sure they agree to bring you back on the camel so you don't have to walk all the way.  The sunset was awesome.  Buskers play zurna and drums if you tip them, but the music was fun to hear on the desert breeze.  The Khuri villages are a treat to visit--so clean and tidy without garbage in the streets.

title: Worth Visit
review: After reaching Jaisalmer we proceeded for the desert safari tour and took a camel ride

title: Amazing Place-- Core Attraction--Must see
review: One must go to the Sam Sand dunes while visiting Jaisalmer. Try to stay one night in the Dunes. One must try the sun rise in the dunes, also since the hotels at Jailsalmer arranges the evening trip to the dunes so it remains  heavily crowded during the evening. The dunes remain really calm and peaceful during the morning so one must attempt the sun rise. Camel safari and Jeep safari may be tried.

title: dune
review: best to go in 'closed car' as dusty & may be risky for open jeeps (which is mostly available) meeting 3 desert with sliding landscape is great. best to go at SUNRISE as most people go at sunset! take time to be in sand or night out under the stary sky is great

title: wonderful experience
review: having seen sand on beaches and never on the plains, it was simply amazing. miles and miles of it. the dunes are great to walk, slide, sleep and do whatever you want. the camel ride was also fantastic. evenings are a bit crowded as most of the tourist crowd come there. mornings on the sand is also good. In all, a good place to relax.

title: Best night
review: Just the best thousand stars hotel haha

title: Camel safari
review: We had a great night here and spent several hours in the dunes being led around by 2 young camel herders.Loved it,especially thhe sunset.Sour butt but great fun.

title: One amazing night
review: I did a camel safari in this desert and it was very nice. At last a place in India where you can get away from all man made things and enjoy the stars, shining bright. Don't put in mind African or middle east deserts though, low vegetation is everywhere. In fact, one has to make an effort to reach those cool looking sand dunes. Having said that, it's a better experience than a completely dry desert as the temperature is not as harsh. Be aware of two things though, it gets quite cold at night and there is camel poo everywhere!

title: Good birding
review: Went to the sudashri outpost basically to see the bustards. Was lucky to spot 4 of them. Lots of raptors as well. Management is close to non existent though

title: Great sights
review: Sam sand dunes pale into insignificance once you get to drive around in the desert national park. It is one of a kind and provides some breathtaking sights of the desert.

title: watch the sunset
review: amazing experience, travel on a camel or camel cart to the sand dunes to watch the sun go down, lose yourself in the beauty of the desert

title: The best way to know about earth!
review: I visited this park with curiosity to know about our earth. Very nicely design & each & every part there is a board of perfect information. Just imagine the world in 180 Million year old. Only for those who want to know more about Jurassic period.

title: India it's also this!
review: Don't miss the desert in Jaisalmer! Especially at the sunset. The colors will leave you breathless. The air is so pure and light, you feel so good! Strong emotions that you will never forget.

title: Nature at its best...
review: A must visit when in jasalmer,amazing views of desert and sunset not to be missed,too many camel riding places do get the best bargain,i recommend jeep safari which is thrilling.

title: Pura Vida!
review: We visited the desert park as part of camel safari. When we started our camel safari, our tour operator stopped only after a short distance and as one can guess, he asked for extra payment to take us farther into the desert park. We agreed and this tour turned out to be the highlight of our trip. We saw the sunset and enjoyed the pure air, tranquil atmosphere, took some beautiful pictures and had a great time!

title: Sunset in desert
review: This is a must visit place around Jaisalmer, Sam sand dunes are located 45km from the city and its worth to drive those extra km to get insane sunset view, enjoy camel ride on sand and Mahindra thar Jeep safari on the desert, which is insane and nowhere else happens in india besides this, also remember to bargain to the fullest

title: Excillant Experiance
review: Unforgettable Experience ,,,,,,,,,,one must visit this place in his life to feel the Desert beauty .....................during my visit i was lucky to see the shooting of Bajarangi Bhaijan also

title: most excited ride
review: went with friend to explore the Dessert safari

title: most Unique Feature of Jaisalmer - The Sam Desert
review: "Sam" is the largest Desert near Jaisalmer and every year a Desert Festival is held here during Winter months. Tourists visit this place from all over the world. There are Camping sites also available where one can stay overnight and enjoy the true life of Desert. Most favorite sport in Sam is a Camel ride and watching the Sun Set.

title: Amazing!!
review: We spent 2 days at this place and was the most beautiful experience ever. Something worth to pay. One night under the stars and the moon. This place is perfect for adventure lovers.

title: The Great Indian desert
review: Amazing. One of a kind attraction of jaisalmer. around 45 odd kms from the city..nice road,windmills,barren land.Experience of a lifetime.the camel safari was awesome.the sand..the sunset..the safari everything was amazing.

title: Nice
review: Its awesome, with Camel riding visit here. But keep a Cap on head. If you are lucky You can see Deer or Tiger.

title: Golden Desert
review: The sand in the desert is like gold. Seeing this makes us remember earth has given many things for us.

title: A visit to jaisalmer
review: This place is located few kms away from jaisalmer , it is a good place to visit if you are fond of deserts but the atmosphere over here is quite fragile in noon and as cool at night. Some of fun activities one can go for is camel riding and at night if you wish to have a camp stay then there is beautiful arrangement made for that, where along with the dinner you can enjoy the rajasthani folk dance .Overall it is fun,preferred to be visited in winters and take the required Sun protection stuff with yourself.

title: A place to drive through
review: It is not like other national park, lots of animals or birds.. it is unique place ... you may see lots of blackbuck or other deers.... indian fowl etc...

title: Excellent
review: This is the one place we came to visit. We got to see all the raptors and many different birds in and around the park. Must visit for any birder.

title: the golden dunes
review: the safari is a unique experience. the jeep runs amoco the sand dunes. the tourists jump many feet in the air due to the invisible sand dunes. they are totally covered with sand from head to toe. but it is a must visit place.

title: Thirsty Camel
review: A desert ride on a camel  is a must and an experience of a life time. Never had the opportunity to ride on a camel and the guy who leads the camel spoke good English and took me through sand dunes and real desert made me feel like Lawrence of Arabia

title: Desart safari
review: They call it, Desart safari, is a must thing in every tourist MENU...good chance to see SUNSET from the edge of sand...can have camel ride OR camel cart ride too..

title: Yes to DNP
review: People everywhere it has to be saved. Save Great Indian Bustard, save grasslands. Save DNP.Worth visiting

title: Nice desert to visit if in India.
review: 2nd alternative to Middle Eastern deserts such as Sahara.

title: Exceptional
review: Nothing much wildlife to see here but its ultimate experience to go by camel and stay for a night here in mud houses or tents. Such organized tours have to be enquired and booked at various travel agencies at Jaisalmer. Use your wisdom to negotiate with them and take full service as people there act much smarter.

title: Nice but over crowded
review: Nice but over crowded  especially later afternoon for viewing sunset....drive till you can, so that less distance to reach the huge sand dunes....negotiate before taking camels.

title: Extremely commercialised
review: This is basically apart of Thar desert where numerous "Tent resorts" have sprung up lately. You can stay in any one of these tents, but be ready to pay for premium even for a bottle of drinking water. The camel ride is simply another way to extort money from gullible travelers. Same goes for Jeep ride in the dunes. My suggestion, visit Kuri dunes instead of SAM dunes and do a lot of research before choosing your resort for the night stay. Avoid Camp-e-Khash at all cost, and I am saying it from my own experience. If you book in advance be ready to pay higher than if you book while in Jaisalmer. Remember, these people has very little for livelihood but tourism but they are not very honest and believing them blindly would most likely land you in a soup.

title: Dont go for it
review: Near the dunes the camel owners will try to forcibly take you there charging extra bucks ..However all you'll get to see is large stretches of barren land...Rather prefer to enjoy the sunset on the dunes...

title: Waste of time and money
review: The camel ride into the Thar desert at sunset was supposed to be the highlight of our tour to Jaisalmer.  It was a total waste of time.  We were constantly surrounded by hordes of other tourists on camel back, tearing around in jeeps, on foot and in carts as far as the eye could see and the sun sadly disappeared behind clouds before it actually set. Rubbish everywhere and we were never out of sight of the road or tent hotels set up to accommodate the hordes of tourists.  I've been told that the overnight treks are  a much better option as you actually go into the dessert. Unless you plan to do that I'd say don't bother.

title: Good park
review: We had camal ride and the boy who was the owner of camal was very young and very talkative so he made the ride enjoyable

title: Deserted
review: The infrastructure needs beefing up. Though we had informed in advance, still we had to wait for the 'driver' of the lone camel cart. The overall feel is good but hardly any animals.

title: Do not go out of your way to visit - ok if you are around
review: If you would like to ride a camel and stand on top of a dune watching the sunset with a lot of other people - this is the place to go. There are a lot of resorts here, but there is not a lot to see.

title: Tourist mess
review: We visited the Park on the way through to a set of sandhills more out of the way. This is a pretty aweful place I'm sorry to say.

title: AWESOME
review: Do visit and insist the drivers for a full tour, you are bound to see gazzells. The desert looks panoramic  at many parts. Those forested but still sandy.

title: Might depend where you go...
review: We did one of the 2 days, 1 night camel trips.

title: Must visit
review: Stretch your budget a bit and rush to Sam to feel the waves of dessert. If possible stay overnight in some camp. Enjoy the camel ride. Jeep safari. Village life. Folk songs and dance in the camp. Most importantly don't miss the dance of lights during sun rise and sun set. I visited in Jan and experienced the climate change in dessert. From sunny day to chilly nights in camp

title: Busy but worth the visit
review: We travelled at high season so the dunes were very busy. But we enjoyed the camel safari all the same.

title: Good one
review: You may have seen many national park, but this is different, based in desert and almost no trees.

title: Awesome place
review: a huge desert with various landscapes of sand dunes, rocky terrain and arid scrub covered ground. silent, vast and natural.

title: Must to do
review: It was an amazing experience to visit the Desert. Did dune bashing by jeep which was out of world experience. Its the most thrilling experience and the jeep takes you to aloof untouched places which is worth it. Later even did the camel riding but these places were crowded with many people. For some extra money the camel can take you to interior part of desert too only if you are fond of riding one. I suggest jeep safari

title: Very average
review: You hardly get to see anything except for a lone deer wandering through the dunes and some vegetation. Definitely not worth visiting

title: Camel safaree
review: Trotters were wonderful. they made me feel like a long lost friend.

title: We should have spend more time
review: We went for dune bashing and had a thrilling jeep safari. The driver is from ratnavali camp and we had a good time doing dune bashing while going to and from the dunes. Saw the sunset and it was very beautiful . Saw a deer twice.

title: Garbage free and deserted!
review: Finally a tourist attraction not jam packed full of litter! Desert Camel safari is high on my list of India recommendations, especially doing an overnight stay to fully appreciate the spectacular views and sleeping under the stars. Definitely Jaisalmers selling point as we weren't too impressed with much else!

title: Sunrise
review: the rawness of the Thar is best seen here. The exceptional beauty of the dessert at sunrise was a memory that will stay a lifetime,

title: Beautiful site of Sand Dunes
review: You can see miles of desert and enjoy walking and sliding on sand dunes. Beautiful Sunset. Take a Camel Back ride but very very crowded during holiday season.

title: Awesome!
review: Not to be missed. If one is in Jaisalmer, they should not miss doing a Desert Safari. Its the best thing to do here. The camel ride, the setting sun against the sand dunes, are simply mesmerising.

title: Sam sand dunes- photogenic hues
review: Sam sand dunes are located about 60 kms from jaisalmer city !! Take a camel ride and stay in tented accomodation to savour rajasthani cuisine and watch kalbeliya dance sitting around a bonfire on a chilly desert night and enjoying rajasthani folksongs !!!!!! U cnt ask for more romantic and unforgettable getaway without heading to dubai !!!!!!!!!

title: Must do if you are in Rajasthan
review: Now that the Govt. has made the desert green, sand dunes have shifted far off from the national park entry point. But its a boon in disguise as you can ride the camel for a good 30 min + before reaching the actual dunes. And once you reach there, trust me its an awesome experience to watch the desert sun setting. My family visited the deserts earlier as well and they felt it has become much more safe now than before.

title: Once in a lifetime experience!
review: A trip to the desert was among the greatest highlights of our whole journey around Rajastan. This was indeed a once in a lifetime experience, something we would never forget. The first thing was the camel ride. We were a little bit scared at the beginning, especially that after walking for a couple of minutes, the camels actually started to gallop – that was really fast! As soon as the first fear is away, there is only you and the camel and the desert. Amazing! You leave behind little villages surrounded by bushes, and go to sand dunes. If you are lucky, as we were, you are taken to a rather lonely place, not one where all the crowds gather to watch the sunset. You lay down on the surprisingly cool sand   and feel that time has stopped. Then the sun starts to go down, showing everything around in wonderful light – orange, red, purple. And then the night comes, it gets a bit cold, but you still do not want to leave. You do eventually, with such peace and harmony inside. I know this was only our individual experience, and maybe you would not love it as much as we did. But do give it a try – it is really worth it!

title: Amazing Wildlife
review: Spent 4 days exploring the park and could have spend another 2-3 days. Spotted approx. 50 Bird species along with several mammals. Go for it birders!!!

title: Mesmerising Thar!!!
review: The thar desert is quite mesmerising indeed, it was a dream come true to see one. The camel rides are quite intriguing and delightful.

title: Mesmerizing
review: A trip to the Thar desert near Jaisalmer was really thrilling. Take the road from Jaisalmer and after 45 kms of smooth drive, the sight of the sand dunes at Sam is quite magical.

title: We spent one night, and maybe we should've spent more...
review: On our way out for our safari, we met a group who had been out for 3 days and were absolutely delighted about their trip. Our 1 night in the Thar was "just okay," so maybe we needed to have gone further into the desert to really enjoy it. Sleeping out under the stars was a wonderful experience (I saw 7 shooting stars!), but I'm not sure my body could take it for more than 1-2 nights! Riding on a camel for any length of time does a number on your muscles, so bring some ibuprofen to ease your pain! Do your research to find out what kind of safari you want and find a good company (Abu Safari gave us fantastic service!).

title: A place well-hidden n remote..inaccessible
review: I didnt see this park but visited .the road to desert national park is horrible n extremely narrow. Our car got stuck in d sand n thnx to d local people.you will never get enough sign boards  n asking locals won't help.there is a looooongg road to this park.you will definitely feel like you r being fooled as u wont spot a single vehicle on road.do  well your homework n collect necessary info bfore going der..

title: Enjoy the desert in a less touristy place than Sam Dunes
review: The Desert National Park is a great place to enjoy the Sand Dunes near Jaisalmer. Trips to this area are organized by various tour operators (and hotel) in Jaisalmer. It is not crowded unlike the Sam dunes, which are super populated with camps full of over-night and visiting tourists. A typical trip consists of a ride to the area, followed by some camel riding and then watching the sunset. Some tourists also have dinner and then sleep under the stars. We chose to leave for dinner to a tent/camp in the Sam dune area - it would have been better for us to stay here, have a simple dinner and enjoy the calm night for a few more hours. Pick this over a visit to the Sam dunes.

title: "Adventures place"
review: i travelled there for 5 hours... its an exiting place to visit with your friends..... totally enjoyed alot ...!!! animals and environment there was double awsome .." i really enjoyed upto my fullest....

title: A gem in the desert
review: A treasure trove for any nature lover and birdwatcher. Great place to see the great Indian bustard and host of raptors. Staff are very friendly, especially foresters Mr. Hazara Ram and Mr. Buddha Ram were great in spotting birds and mammals.

title: Island of adventure
review: The Desert National Park in the Thar desert is a unique type of wildlife safari. You are taken into the vast expanse of desert and scrubland on a camel cart.

title: Dessert
review: It is perfect if you could ride a camel and then have dinner over there. Depends on the month you visit you could spend a night sleeping in the dessert which is very recommended.

title: Great Day Trip
review: The quiet, the light, the expanse - nothing is quite like the desert. And if you can avoid the hawkers and dancing children foisted at you for payment, it can be quite magical and moving.

title: The only Desert national park in Rajasthan
review: Very nice park.  We could go on a desert camel safari and see real desert San dunes. We also saw the sun set from there. Watched Folk dance and had a simple buffett dinner in a resort there.

title: amazing
review: We went on desert safari, stayed overnight in the desert under the stars. It was one of the best experiences ever.

title: visit only if u love Nature .....or do not go
review: Yes ......there is no sine board.......no one to welcome U ......no one to guide u.....

title: Nice to Find such place.
review: The Desert Nation Part is a good place to visit.

title: A lovely place to observe the desert eco system
review: Just an hour away from jaisalmer is the Desert National Park , most  even in jaisalmer have no clue of its existence , which is such a bliss , the place is very rustic and the vices of tourism are nowhere t be seen  , a perfect place to see the endangerd great indian bustard and desert foxes and other life that thirves in the desert , read raptor birds , lizards , snakes etc.....go and explore and you will be mesmerized for sure

title: No desert
review: We went there to see sand but didnt see. Only bushes. Why so? Even the camel safari was in bushes. No sand. :(

title: if possible to see indian mustard bird
review: watch if u found one other wise one can easily found deers and foxes

title: Not much to see but may be good to visit once
review: As you visit Sam, one can plan & visit this nationsl park a well. It is 21 kms from Sam and about 30 mins by car. The entry fee is around 30rs per person. Its better to hire a camel car to see the park as its spread in multi-kms of radius. Though not much animals can be seen but one can spot chinkara, foxes, few birds... thats it.

title: Different tour
review: To get here, you *MUST* have a permit from the National Parks office.  It is quite different tot he Sam area (dunes) and the ability to see fauna is not always easy but when you do, it's quite breathtaking.

title: Fabulous for bird lovers and Antelope sightings.
review: A beautiful part of Rajasthan especially in the winter months when you see a lot more bird life and lots of Antelopes around. This is one of the places to see the majestic Godavan bird.

title: great experience
review: I went to this desert with my girlfriend. It ws great. The desert doesn't have huge dunes, but you can have a nice ride and sunset view on a camel.

title: A wildlife safari with a difference
review: The Desert National Park in the Thar desert is a unique type of wildlife safari. You are taken into the vast expanse of desert and scrubland on a camel cart. One can expect to see a large variety of birds there. We were fortunate to spot 6 Great Indian Bustards, a critically endangered bird along with many griffon vultures, wheatears. kestrels, egyptian vultures, etc besides some shy chinkara's and some desert hare's too.

title: Good fun with children
review: We went yo desert park in December, well we took a camel ride ,kids were very excited to spot  Fox, rabbits, antelopes and some birds. Overall good experience.

title: beautiful dunes!
review: We had a lovely experience in the dunes-- camping in two-person  tents with campfire, music, and good food.      Camel riding at sunset.    A good memory!    and well organized-- despite the warnings we'd heard--- as we went with Killa Bhawan Haveli to arrange the camel/camping.

title: For Bird watchers only
review: The National Park is for only those who are interested in Wildlife especially bird watching, since it is a desert no large predators are present. The place is excellent for birders with attractions like Great Indian and Houbara Bustard, White-browed Bushchat, Desert Warbler, Isabelline, Red-tailed, Variable and Pied Weather and much more

title: Camel travel
review: What a wonderful way to experience the dessert sunset, though as a horse rider I took to it more easily than my husband. We saw vultures and deer as well as many birds and plants.

title: deer park
review: I got to see live deer and it was organised by the Hotel staff for me at Hotel Marina mahal. I liked this as i saw some wild life in a desert which i have not seen before

title: Lovely place to come to yourself
review: A lovely place to come to yourself and meet you shadow :) Traveling on camels, watching for wild animals, jumping from the dunes, I love the dessert...

title: must visit
review: The region is a heaven for migratory and resident birds of the desert. One can see many Eagles, Harriers, Falcons, Buzzards, Kestrel and Vultures. Short- toed Eagles, Tawny Eagles, Spotted Eagles, Laager Falcons and Kestrels are the most common among these

title: not a sanctuary as such, more on the lines of desert feel
review: Sanctuary doesnt have any animals to brag or show. As such there is more of desert and less of sanctuary around here. go for the feel.

title: Amazing Landscape and Nice Sand Dunes ......... A Nice and Quite Place to Visit
review: Desert National Park is a quite and tranquil place with amazing landscape and sand dunes. The park is home to Indian Gazelle (Chinkara), desert fox, Great Indian Bustard and many other bird spices including different eagles and hawks. The desert animals are plentiful in number and a visit to the park ensures many sightings. The sand dunes are nice and most places are undisturbed from human footsteps which is a great site for photographers. During my visit I found many trails of Gazelle and fox on sand dunes and not many footprints of humans. In 2 hours of strolling through the park I caught sight of many Indian Gazelle (Chinkara), a couple of desert foxes and Great Indian Bustard. The desert landscape looks amazing during sunset which is a great sight for photographers. If you are in Jaisalmer, do not miss the opportunity of going into the desert national park. The best time to visit the park is either during sunrise or during sunset.

title: Desert sand dunes are very few crowded not advises for family with kids and jeep riding is scary
review: Desert sand dunes are very few crowded and jeep riding is scary. The jeep ride can be scary as they drive very fast and bumpy not at all fun and safe. Desert is huge by dunes are few and awfully crowded. Can be avoided and total no of with family and kids

title: Desert National Park
review: there is so many activities are available here, like camel safari, jeep safari, folk dance. we had so much fun here. we had done jeep and camel ride here. tants are also available here if you want to stay here. then we have gone through the folk dance of rajasthan. and at the end of the program, even we had a dance. we have clicked so many pictures and videos here.

title: Best place to experience the Desert in Jaisalmer
review: The Desert National Park is a must visit for any nature enthusiast. The sanctuary has many species of birds which include Vultures, Shrikes, Partridges, Eagles, Kestrels, Coursers etc. (only to name a few)

title: The Desert Endemics
review: Shrubs, unending vistas of sand, driving in and around the DNP was a mersmerising experience.... adding to this wonder was sighting the birds who were so well cameoflaged- the guest of honour- The Great Indian Bustard, creme courser, desert wheatear, red tailed wheatear, issabeline and variable wheatear, striolated bunting, trumpeter finch, asian desert warbler, greater short toed lark, greater hoopoelark,, blackcrowned sparrowlark, bimaculated lark, desert lark.....it was delightful watching the imperial eagle, tawny eagle, laggar falcon along with 6 different types if vultures out in the open, standing out in the vastness.

title: Interesting ecosystem
review: Very original name, but the park seems well kept, not many sand dunes, probably due to the sheer number of people here, several camel/truck hire places beating the sand and ancient salt crusts away. The roads are quite well looked after and are quite eerie at sundown!

title: Experience the Wild West
review: A must visit for those who want to see the desert. Most of the terrain is flat arid desert,sand dunes are few. We spotted a sleepy desert fox with a bushy white tail, couple of eagles and deer. The roads are really good and it covers two or three different areas. If one is lucky one could spot the great India Bustard, but we did not see any of though. A special mention about Aliyar  Rojani who took us on the safari and his knowledge of the fauna here.

title: Mesmerising, Mind blowing
review: This was by far our best experience in Rajasthan. The desert national park is a world apart and doesn't feel like you're in India. You would feel like you are in the deserts of another country. Minimal habitat, little houses in the middle of nowhere, small kids looking at you with so much of love and admiration is something you will never forget. The landscape is superb, especially near some famous spots where the cactus plants grow tall. If you are in Jaisalmer, this place is a must visit. If you are a wildlife enthusiast like me, you might want to also try and catch a glimpse of the Great Indian Bustard, a species that we might only see in books in the near future. You should just go there for the experience and I'm sure you'll be in awe of the clean and pristine sand dunes inside the national park.

title: Family visit
review: The camel ride is real wonderful experience. The tents and the music and dance program are refreshing and enjoyable

title: A paradise for wildlife enthusiasts
review: If you are a keen wildlife lover and want to explore some beyond the usual attractions of Jaisalmer then DNP is a good option. We specially here to spot GIB and we were very very lucky to spot 7 GIB at the same time. We also saw vultures, chinkaras, and a desert cat. Only go here if you love wildlife. It is a treat for experiencing desert wildlife.

title: Interesting National Park
review: You realize it is there when you are moving towards the dunes; the signboard announces that. However to naked eye and someone just looking you do not find much except rocks and a few birds with a bit of vegetation thrown in. I wish I could explore it properly.

title: Desert National Park
review: there is so many activities are available here, like camel safari, jeep safari, folk dance. we had so much fun here. we had done jeep and camel ride here. tants are also available here if you want to stay here. then we have gone through the folk dance of rajasthan. and at the end of the program, even we had a dance. we have clicked so many pictures and videos here.

review: This was by far our best experience in Rajasthan. The desert national park is a world apart and doesn't feel like you're in India. You would feel like you are in the deserts of another country. Minimal habitat, little houses in the middle of nowhere, small kids looking at you with so much of love and admiration is something you will never forget. The landscape is superb, especially near some famous spots where the cactus plants grow tall. If you are in Jaisalmer, this place is a must visit. If you are a wildlife enthusiast like me, you might want to also try and catch a glimpse of the Great Indian Bustard, a species that we might only see in books in the near future. You should just go there for the experience and I'm sure you'll be in awe of the clean and pristine sand dunes inside the national park.

title: Interesting ecosystem
review: Very original name, but the park seems well kept, not many sand dunes, probably due to the sheer number of people here, several camel/truck hire places beating the sand and ancient salt crusts away. The roads are quite well looked after and are quite eerie at sundown!

title: Experience the Wild West
review: A must visit for those who want to see the desert. Most of the terrain is flat arid desert,sand dunes are few. We spotted a sleepy desert fox with a bushy white tail, couple of eagles and deer. The roads are really good and it covers two or three different areas. If one is lucky one could spot the great India Bustard, but we did not see any of though. A special mention about Aliyar  Rojani who took us on the safari and his knowledge of the fauna here.

title: Family visit
review: The camel ride is real wonderful experience. The tents and the music and dance program are refreshing and enjoyable

title: A paradise for wildlife enthusiasts
review: If you are a keen wildlife lover and want to explore some beyond the usual attractions of Jaisalmer then DNP is a good option. We specially here to spot GIB and we were very very lucky to spot 7 GIB at the same time. We also saw vultures, chinkaras, and a desert cat. Only go here if you love wildlife. It is a treat for experiencing desert wildlife.

title: Interesting National Park
review: You realize it is there when you are moving towards the dunes; the signboard announces that. However to naked eye and someone just looking you do not find much except rocks and a few birds with a bit of vegetation thrown in. I wish I could explore it properly.

title: Desert sand dunes are very few crowded not advises for family with kids and jeep riding is scary
review: Desert sand dunes are very few crowded and jeep riding is scary. The jeep ride can be scary as they drive very fast and bumpy not at all fun and safe. Desert is huge by dunes are few and awfully crowded. Can be avoided and total no of with family and kids

title: Desert National Park
review: there is so many activities are available here, like camel safari, jeep safari, folk dance. we had so much fun here. we had done jeep and camel ride here. tants are also available here if you want to stay here. then we have gone through the folk dance of rajasthan. and at the end of the program, even we had a dance. we have clicked so many pictures and videos here.

title: The Desert Endemics
review: Shrubs, unending vistas of sand, driving in and around the DNP was a mersmerising experience.... adding to this wonder was sighting the birds who were so well cameoflaged- the guest of honour- The Great Indian Bustard, creme courser, desert wheatear, red tailed wheatear, issabeline and variable wheatear, striolated bunting, trumpeter finch, asian desert warbler, greater short toed lark, greater hoopoelark,, blackcrowned sparrowlark, bimaculated lark, desert lark.....it was delightful watching the imperial eagle, tawny eagle, laggar falcon along with 6 different types if vultures out in the open, standing out in the vastness.
